computer.description:
Even though we know almost nothing about this Micral series, it was probably one of the first of the Micral 80xx series to be designed by R2E.
Its hardware design was the same as the first Micral models, a bus card mounted along with several daughter boards. In the following models, i.e. the 8020 series, R2E had used a single board with expansion slots.
The Micral 8030 and 8031 belonged to the same family. At least 4 versions of 8031 were launched, from A to D, but we don't know the technical distinctions between each version.
computer.keyboard: Full stroke 78 key with numeric keypad
computer.name: Micral 8030 series
computer.peripherals: Numerous boards were made by R2E

shot.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> KEYBOARD #2</strong></font><br><blockquote>Notice the <b>64/96</b> Characters/line toggle key, and the <b>Buff Char</b> key which probably allowed to save the screen content to a buffer zone. </blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> INSIDE</strong></font><br><blockquote>Five cards are inserted into the basket:<br> • Z80 CPU / ROM / RAM card<br> • 'Multibus' card<br> • I/O card<br> • Video card<br> • 32 KB RAM extension card</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> KEYBOARD PROCESSOR</strong></font><br><blockquote>The keyboard uses its own Z80 processor and associated EPROM. An expensive choice at the time!</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> REAR SIDE</strong></font><br><blockquote><font color="blue"><b>(1)</font></b> Video DB15 connector<br> <font color="blue"><b>(2)</font></b> Serial DB15 connector<br> <font color="blue"><b>(3)</font></b> Parallel printer DB25 connector<br><br> Notice the nice blue color of the bottom shell of the case -) </blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> MICRAL LABEL</strong></font><br><blockquote>Although the computer is labelled 8031b, the rear label mentions 8030b.<br> The serial number probably means that this computer was the 156th model manufactured during the 40th week of the year 1979. </blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> SYSTEM CARDS</strong></font><br><blockquote>3 of the system cards:<br> • Video card (top)<br> • 32 KB RAM expansion card<br> • CPU / 2 KB ROM / 16 KB RAM card</blockquote>
